conclusion: Analyze the motion of the objects and the forces acting on them.
Object A moves vertically, Object B moves along the inclined plane, angle of inclination is 37 degrees, acceleration due to gravity is 10 m/s^2.
Calculate force on object A as 10 N.
Calculate force on object B as 6 N.
Calculate net force on the system as 4 N.
Calculate total mass of the system as 2 kg.
Calculate acceleration of the system as 2 m/s^2.
Initial height of object A is 1 m.
Calculate final velocity of object B when A hits the ground as 2 m/s.
After the string breaks, object B moves up the incline with initial velocity 2 m/s.
Calculate acceleration up the incline as -6 m/s^2.
Calculate time to reach maximum height as 1/3 s.
Calculate maximum height reached as 1/3 m.
Calculate acceleration down the incline as 6 m/s^2.
Calculate time to return to the bottom as 1/3 s.
Calculate total time to return to the bottom as 2/3 s.
Final answer is the time required for object B to return to the bottom of the inclined plane is 1 s.
